actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Government Operations.

official_title: A bill to establish an Office of Spanish-Speaking Affairs in the Executive Office of the President.

summary.text: Establishes the Office of Spanish-Speaking Affairs in the Executive Office of the President to advise the executive branch on appropriate actions to assure that Federal programs are providing needed assistance to Spanish-speaking and Spanish-surnamed Americans and to advise them on needed new programs regarding such peoples, and to advise such Americans on receiving Federal assistance. Permits the Director of the Office to appoint advisory task forces to advise him on his functions under this Act. Creates the Spanish-Speaking Affairs coordinating council, composed of specified executive officials. Terminates this Act five years after it becomes effective.

titles.title: A bill to establish an Office of Spanish-Speaking Affairs in the Executive Office of the President.
